reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Effective responses to drug-resistant tuberculosis in Kazakhstan

description.narrative: Kazakhstan - Tuberculosis - RSE on REU “National Scientific Center of Phthisiopulmonology of the Republic of Kazakhstan” of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan - RSE on REU “NSCP RK" MH RK. This program has the following goals: Effective responses to drug-resistant tuberculosis in Kazakhstan sustained through people-centered and evidence-based approaches, including those for vulnerable and at-risk populations. The objectives of this program are: To ensure comprehensive and sustainable health system responses to DR-TB challenge. To sustain universal access to quality and people-centered DR-TB diagnosis, treatment and prevention

title.narrative: Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
HSS-other 2: Average length of in-patient treatment

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among prisoners
HSS-other 1: Number and percentage of TB beds reduced
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
MDR TB-other 1: Number of cases of XDR TB enrolled on treatment
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Percentage of new and relapse TB patients tested using WHO recommended rapid tests at the time of diagnosis
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
